comments.author: jennifer
comments.body: "Dave" and "Mark" are appropriately large, though why "Steve" takes a backseat I'm not sure. Was this handmade? 'Cause I don't see the Gunthenator anywhere on there...

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Good point. Where the hell is the Gunthenator? Mark, did you click the "Filter subversives" button before you rendered this thing? That might explain it. DU

comments.author: Werner
comments.body: I'm not sure why the Gunthernator didn't make it in. I guess it's time for Jennifer to start spamming the blog to get her numbers up. I'll get things started: Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator Gunthernator ... That ought to help! :-)

comments.author: Adriana
comments.body: I think it's particularly appropriate that "scientists" and "speedlimping" are one on top of the other. "Speedlimping" is the perfect way to describe how I envision my next three years of science research at CU. (In fact, maybe it is also no coincidence that "slavery" appears nearby.)

comments.author: Werner
comments.body: Nah, the spam didn't seem to help. See this revised wordle: [BROKEN_URL] Maybe there is something to Dave's suggestion. Or maybe I left the synonym filter on and it translated Gunthernator into "speedlimping." :-) Mark. P.S. I think the wordle tool doesn't pick up on the blog comments.
